Text:
Are you traveling back home after the holidays? Don’t forget to take a COVID-19 test to ensure infection rates don’t skyrocket this winter. You can order FREE at-home testing kits that are shipped to your door. 
https://t.co/hKKY04vcd9

Wishing everyone a Happy New Year! 🎉

In 2022, I worked to cap insulin costs for Medicare recipients, cut energy costs for NH families, secure funds for local infrastructure projects & much more. I look forward to continuing to serve Granite Staters in 2023. https://t.co/h0yjn1WMVI

Proud to support continued assistance to Ukraine in this year's #NDAA. This aid sends a clear signal to Putin that the U.S. remains firmly committed to our democratic partners and in fierce opposition to his brutal war waged in 🇺🇦 https://t.co/vzJO52tYXy

The FY23 #NDAA includes my Homeland Procurement Reform (HOPR) Act to ensure @DHSgov procures American-made uniforms and other PPE. Bolstering our domestic supply chain & manufacturing sector is a national security priority, & this provision will help us meet that goal. https://t.co/FX41OzyCDw

✅Resources to combat the substance use disorder epidemic.

✅Essential reforms to protect our democracy by updating the Electoral Count Act.

And more!

✅Record-level funding to support survivors of sexual and domestic violence for the sixth year in a row. 

✅Reauthorization of the Afghan SIV program & 4,000 additional visas for FY 2023.

NEW: The bipartisan FY23 gov’t funding bill has been signed into law! As a senior member of the Senate Appropriations Committee, I worked to secure the inclusion of numerous NH and national priorities including:🧵

Local CAP agencies are instrumental to helping Granite Staters access home heating assistance. I appreciate their work to help families like Elvira’s stay warm. Don’t hesitate to reach out to your local CAP if you need help paying heating bills. 

https://t.co/aYIQg3ihGN

John was a good man, who always put his community first. As we mourn his passing, I hope we can take a page from his book and do what we can with the time we have to support & look out for one another. My thoughts are with his family during this difficult time.

I was fortunate to know John during my tenure as Governor & later in the U.S. Senate, and among his many accomplishments, revered him for his service through the Northern Forest Lands Council, ushering through many conservation projects.

John’s coverage of the tragic Drega murders earned him national recognition, weaving compassion for the Phillips, Lord, Bunnel & Joos families with intrepid reporting to reflect how the community held together in their mourning.
It’s been a difficult few days since the passing of John Harrigan. I’ve spent time reflecting on the indelible mark he left on the North Country community & our state.

Thrilled that my legislation, the FENTANYL Results Act, was included in #NDAA. As fentanyl fuels the addiction crisis in NH & across the nation, @StateDept must work w/ our partners and take steps to identify, track & detect synthetic controlled substances. https://t.co/5flwuEUd6F

I am also glad that the #NDAA includes a record $20 million to continue the PFAS health study that began at Pease, which I fought to establish. We must leave no stone unturned in understanding the impacts of PFAS on our communities.
I also fought to ensure that this important legislation prioritizes PFAS remediation and clean-up efforts and promotes more effective and transparent info sharing w/ communities impacted by PFAS.
W/ my provisions, @DeptofDefense must stop buying PFAS-laden firefighting equipment by 2026 to better protect service members and firefighters who are too commonly exposed.

PFAS exposure leaves our neighbors, including military families, vulnerable to adverse health impacts. Proud to see my provisions to protect service members and defense communities from PFAS included in this year’s #NDAA. 🧵 https://t.co/XH641YsETl

Need help paying for home heating bills this winter? Applications are currently being accepted for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) and Weatherization Assistance Programs (WAP): 

Apply through your local CAP: 
https://t.co/PjN5nbDUBq https://t.co/auivSfpCkk
A friendly reminder that the Open Enrollment period is still ongoing. Shop around for an affordable health care plan for you and your family before the January 15th deadline:  https://t.co/tPQfI3brFe
The Portsmouth Naval Shipyard is home to some of the most qualified workers in the nation, & this funding will continue the Shipyard’s naval excellence.
As co-chair of the Senate Navy Caucus, I secured over $500M through the #NDAA to strengthen the submarine industrial base and improve workforce training at our shipyards. https://t.co/EN8sKzwrrX

With COVID-19 cases rising again, consider testing ahead of New Year’s Eve celebrations. You can order FREE at-home testing kits to be shipped straight to your door.  
https://t.co/hKKY04vcd9

The Portsmouth Naval Shipyard is a point of pride for NH & key to our national security. I fought for over $500M through the NDAA to support the Multi-Mission Dry Dock project, which is critical to modernizing the Shipyard. https://t.co/H36ssdocd5

Great to see @SalemHighSchool students giving back this holiday season! Thanks to their efforts, over 1,000 turkey dinners are available for NH families in need.  
https://t.co/OfiXKrgBkM

Wishing all those celebrating a Merry Christmas!🎄

I hope everyone has a safe & happy holiday season. https://t.co/TB1L3KB5Jb

Big thank you to crews working around the clock to restore power to those impacted!❄️ If you’re without power, contact your utility company to report an outage:

Eversource: 1-800-662-7764
Liberty Utilities: 1-855-349-9455
NH Electric Co-op: 1-800-343-6432)
Unitil: 1-888-301-7700

Our veterans put their lives on the line to serve our nation – we owe them a debt of gratitude. Thank you to the Elliot Perry Foundation for stuffing more than 100 stockings with supplies for NH veterans experiencing homelessness this year. 
https://t.co/ckrKTTND1y

Wishing our service members a happy holiday season. Our men & women in uniform put their lives on the line to keep our nation safe & free – the Granite State is holding them in our thoughts. My letter below ⬇️ https://t.co/QLqGC82nC1
Still have some to-do's on your holiday shopping list? Visit a local business to find the perfect gift! Supporting NH small businesses helps create jobs and strengthen our economy. #ShopSmall

Fentanyl is making the substance use disorder crisis more lethal by the day. It’s a killer and we need to get it out of our communities. That effort needs to start by preventing it from crossing our borders. More on my bill that just became law: https://t.co/h3P6XfUQBp

We know that fentanyl is primarily being trafficked from China & Mexico, so it is paramount that we address this issue globally. That’s precisely what the FENTANYL Results Act will do. Now that it’s law, we have a new way to help our nation get a handle on this crisis.

Don’t forget to pack an emergency car kit before traveling to see loved ones this holiday season. Please drive safe and check out these tips on how to build your own car kit: https://t.co/TVVDpFdb7g https://t.co/NlD5IfbcyF

NEW: The FY23 NDAA – now law of the land – illustrates the bipartisan resolve in Congress to keep our nation safe & secure. From combating fentanyl trafficking to bolstering domestic supply chains & delivering aid to Ukraine, I’m proud to have shaped the new annual defense law.

It’s great to see police & school officials in Nashua come together to support families in need around the holidays. Thanks to their efforts, more than 2 dozen families will receive meals & gifts.  
https://t.co/xCsoWJd88T

E-cig makers use deceptive marketing to hook teens on their dangerous products - they must be held accountable. Pleased that following my bill, @US_FDA now recommends collecting user fees from e-cig companies to help fund efforts to combat this crisis.
https://t.co/5JODMzwRiQ

It’s always a good day when we can bring our fellow Americans home. I can only imagine the relief these two individuals & their families are experiencing. The U.S. will not cease in our efforts to bring home all unjustly detained Americans.
https://t.co/UKs1QdLYfc

The impact of Russia’s brutal invasion of Ukraine is deeply personal for our Ukrainian communities in NH. I stand with them and echo President Zelenskyy’s message – aid to Ukraine is not charity. It is an investment in democracy and global security.  
https://t.co/PYzXfpSYtH

Thrilled to see @POTUS sign into law a bipartisan bill I supported to protect firefighters from PFAS chemicals – both in firefighting foam & gear. This an important step to establish best practices to keep firefighters safe on the job.

Be aware: A major winter storm in on the way and will bring intense winds & flooding, with a potential for power outages across NH. Please plan accordingly & avoid the roads if possible to stay safe.  
https://t.co/CFzU01jDHn

We made a promise to protect the brave Afghans who stood by our men & women in uniform to advance the U.S. mission in Afghanistan. Upholding our commitment & ensuring their safety is both a moral obligation & a national security priority. https://t.co/EO0rYVH0Pn

.@ZelenskyyUa is right: the U.S. must continue to stand by our Ukrainian partners. It’s not just the right thing to do as Ukraine defends itself from Russia’s brutal invasion - it’s also an investment in our national security and in the survival of democracy worldwide. https://t.co/57GWMTcPr5

✅Expansion of mental health support 
✅Affordable housing developments 
✅Modernization of @NHNationalGuard facilities 
✅Support for small businesses 
✅Funding for food pantries 
✅Water infrastructure updates and MORE!

✅Expansion of veterans’ services 
✅Resources for public schools

✅Clean energy investments

NEW: As a senior appropriator, I helped secure more than $111M in the government funding bill to support projects across NH. Here's a snapshot of what’s coming to NH through the congressionally-directed spending process: 📸

Diane is a champion for Americans detained abroad, a cause she leads to honor the legacy of her son, James, who was killed by ISIS terrorists. Proud to work w/her on this issue & to see those who target Americans brought to justice. An important read on her advocacy & leadership.

.@ZelenskyyUa is a hero. He is courageously leading his nation as Ukraine fights for its freedom and for democracies worldwide. His address to Congress – and the American public - was important to remind us why we must stand by our partners in Ukraine.

Congrats to @JenCromptonWMUR on her well-deserved retirement! I’ve always enjoyed checking in w/ her & appreciate her decades of dedication & commitment to keeping NH communities informed. Jen has been a staple in the media community & will be dearly missed!

Attn. Granite Staters: Friday’s storm system is expected to bring heavy rain, strong wind and potential icy conditions across NH. Stay safe & be careful around holiday travel.  
https://t.co/X6Vw2Ir9Uh

Thrilled to see $45M now available to implement updated building energy codes in BIL following implementation of my bill w/ @senrobportman. These grants will improve energy efficiency in buildings, lower costs & support good jobs.
I’m leading a bipartisan letter with @senrobportman to urge the Admin to swiftly update these standards. https://t.co/ErIcKPZzW3

Federally backed homes currently use woefully outdated energy standards. Building new homes to the most up-to-date codes makes a tremendous difference—it saves $$ and makes homes more comfortable while cutting emissions.

It’s devastating that overdose deaths in Nashua & Manchester continue to skyrocket.  

I’ll continue to prioritize securing resources – including through the 2023 gov’t funding bill – to bolster our response to the substance use disorder epidemic to put this crisis behind us.

We'll be voting on the gov’t funding bill soon. It includes several of my efforts to confront the substance use disorder crisis, which worsened during COVID. Let’s get this done & deliver it to @POTUS' desk so communities have tools they need to save lives.

I’m thrilled to welcome over $5.5M to NH from the bipartisan infrastructure law to expand broadband through planning & developing infrastructure. As a lead negotiator around broadband provisions in this law, it’s rewarding to see this funding in action.

In 2021, NH law enforcement reported a nearly 80% jump in hate crimes across our state.  

Hatred & violence have no place in our communities – we must root out this bigotry & hold responsible those who threaten public safety. 
https://t.co/rqUfNYqw24

Sex education programs help reduce teen pregnancy rates & provide essential info on reproductive health, STI’s & more. The Executive Council’s decision to reject funding for these programs puts Granite State youth at risk. Read more below⬇️
https://t.co/QMVM6ww6EM

Afghan women continue to bear the brunt of the Taliban’s abhorrent violence & revocation of rights. The U.S. and the global community must uphold our promise to safeguard fundamental freedoms – like access to education – for Afghan women & hold the Taliban to account.

A bittersweet day in the Senate as my friend, @SenatorLeahy, bids farewell. Thank you for your decades of service, Pat – it's been an honor to partner with you in serving New England communities. Thankfully, I’m just a quick trip over the border, I’ll see you soon!

🚀🧪Investments to advance U.S. space exploration, support the implementation of the CHIPS & Science Act, support climate science through @NOAA and strengthen STEM education.  
 
& so much more. I'll continue working in the Senate to pass this bill & deliver these wins for NH.
🇺🇸🚚Critical funding to bolster domestic manufacturing, support @US_EDA & advance New Hampshire’s outdoor recreation sector.

🏥As the substance use disorder epidemic continues to evolve & impact our communities, I secured $608M to help communities & first responders address this crisis. From expanding access to treatment to supporting law enforcement, this $$ will make a real difference.

⚖️Record funding for Violence Against Women Act programs, which help support survivors, train officials, process rape kits, strengthen domestic violence hotlines & support women’s shelters. I also secured $1.9B for the Crime Victims Fund.
As Chair of the CJS Appropriations Subcommittee, I helped secure many NH priorities in the final govt funding bill for FY 2023. Here are some of the highlights:🧵

Renewable energy is not only a win for our environment, but it also creates jobs & strengthens America’s energy independence. It’s great to see @Forest_Society's new solar array at The Rocks in Bethlehem.  
https://t.co/qwpAxfc5KD

Reforms to safeguard our elections and democracy are overdue. The Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transitions Improvement Act will strengthen our democracy for generations to come - I’m glad these essential reforms will soon be law.
https://t.co/IsphDhvOXD

There has long been bipartisan support for the SIV program. It’s about honoring our promise to those who stood by us, at great risk to themselves & their families. It’s not a partisan issue. It's a nat sec priority & a moral prerogative.

NEW! The gov’t funding bill for FY23 includes an extension of the Afghan SIV program & 4k more visas. While I’m frustrated partisan obstruction necessitated an eleventh-hour solution, I'm relieved that this bill will provide for our Afghan allies who served beside U.S. troops.

I welcome the appointment of @joekennedy as the next U.S. Special Envoy to Northern Ireland. His role will be critical to ensuring peace & economic prosperity in the region. The U.S. remains committed to the Belfast Good Friday Agreement ahead of its 25th anniversary in April.

Fentanyl use is soaring among young people, many of whom acquire drugs through social media. That’s why I’m introducing a bipartisan bill to require social media companies to report illicit drug activity on their platforms, helping law enforcement stem the flow of illicit drugs.

Happy first night of Chanukah to our Jewish friends and neighbors in NH and across the nation! I hope the next 8 days are filled with joy and peace for you and your loved ones. https://t.co/BOOPPKzwYS

ICYMI: COVID-19 cases are rising again. Testing is a critical piece to keeping this virus under control. A reminder that FREE at-home testing kits are now available – order today for 4 kits to be shipped straight to your door. 
https://t.co/khWt2J8aRk

The Holiday Cards 4 Our Military – NH Challenge is an annual tradition spearheaded by Laura Landerman-Garber to deliver warm wishes & gratitude to our troops. It’s wonderful to participate again this year, & I thank Laura for organizing the Challenge year after year! https://t.co/P23PEfU644

The Biden admin unveiled an opioid overdose dashboard to track cases nationwide. This data will help us respond to this pressing crisis and ensure resources are directed to the hardest hit communities. 
https://t.co/aMghZWRoWj

Teen overdose deaths increased by 100%+ from 2019-2021. Cracking down on the flow of fentanyl is crucial to save lives & prevent another generation from succumbing to addiction. I’ll keep pushing to stop fentanyl trafficking & expand access to treatment. 
https://t.co/S4bTbZwFFQ
The winter season is upon us – avoid driving while the plows are cleaning up and keep these handy tips in mind to be prepared on the roads and stay safe.
My thoughts are with her sister, Patty, and brother-in-law, Rik, during this difficult time.

Like all those who are missing her right now, I am brokenhearted by her passing, but I’m grateful that she chose my office, my staff & our shared causes to devote her time to. I will treasure those memories & see her spirit & work carried on in the men & women she mentored.

Judy devoted her life to public service – specifically, to bettering the lives of Granite Staters. And over the years, she mentored countless members of my staff & young activists who wanted to learn from her and work beside her.
Judy was by my side when we expanded kindergarten for NH children, defended women’s reproductive rights, defended the ACA for years in the U.S. Senate, & stood w/ me through every tough re-election.

Few people have had an impact on my life, personally & professionally, as much as Judy Reardon. From the NH State Senate, to the Governor’s office and to the U.S. Senate, Judy filled numerous roles on my staff. But most importantly, she was my confidante & dear friend.

NEW: Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, but they remain vulnerable to cyberattacks & natural disasters. This week, two of my bills to protect small businesses both off- and online are headed to the President’s desk to be signed into law.
https://t.co/dbPRs0N9hF

Don’t miss out: The bipartisan infrastructure law provides eligible households $30/month off their internet bills. If you need help with your bills, learn more about help that’s available here:
https://t.co/XJfgJfshZx

While I’m relieved this CR avoids a disastrous shutdown, funding the gov't shouldn’t be a crisis manufactured by the GOP each year. I look forward to Congress voting on a full gov’t funding package next week, given our national security & essential gov't operations are at stake.

✅ my bill to crack down on international trafficking of fentanyl
✅ my bill to strengthen supply chains of PPE & military equipment
✅ aid to Ukraine
✅ support for communities impacted by PFAS contamination
✅ investments in the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard & more!

Big news for NH: The Senate just passed the annual defense bill, which is always an important opportunity to address critical national security priorities and issues facing NH. Proud to have secured the following:

With COVID-19 cases rising again, free at-home COVID-19 testing kits are now available. All households can order 4 free COVID test kits to be shipped straight to your door.  
 
Order here 👇
https://t.co/khWt2J8aRk

Former Defense Secretary Ash Carter was a patriot whose legacy is still felt today. His guidance on U.S. national security & his support for women in combat & for transgender service members made America stronger. Proud to join a bipartisan resolution honoring his memory.

Thrilled to welcome over $1.6M for rural businesses & entrepreneurs across NH for energy projects. From installing solar arrays to investing in renewable energy systems, these projects save Granite Staters money & help combat the climate crisis. 
https://t.co/eWPm8LmMYP

🚨 The deadline to enroll in health care coverage starting Jan. 1, 2023 is TONIGHT at midnight. 4 in 5 people will have premiums totaling less than $10 - I encourage you to shop for a plan that’s right for you & your family.

Visit https://t.co/tPQfI3brFe

Big thank you to @NHNationalGuard for helping Santa deliver presents for thousands of NH children this year! Operation Santa Claus is a decades-long tradition in our state & I’m glad to see it continue delivering joy for so many families.  
https://t.co/DdC8mKvVIY

I’m heartened to see the @DoverNHPolice continue its holiday tradition of handing out Christmas dinners to local families. This act of kindness brings joy to the Dover community and serves as a reminder of the true meaning of the holidays.
https://t.co/qQNepTP1Ke

Today, my thoughts are with the friends and family of Joseph Eggleston. He will be sorely missed by all who knew him, including his neighbors in Randolph & colleagues at the Cog Railway.  
https://t.co/hLyXD1A3kC

The Iranian regime has violated fundamental rights for millions of women & girls. Ousting Iran from the @UN_CSW is an important signal to the women of Iran that we stand with them and against regime’s violence.
https://t.co/xFeQn3MdVG

The rights of women & girls around the world can't be an afterthought. It’s outrageous that the GOP continues to play politics w/ Dr. Gupta’s nomination to serve as Ambassador of Global Women’s Issues. W/out an ambassador, a critical function of U.S. foreign policy is undermined. https://t.co/tZCZBN8oOs

I’ll say it again: there’s a lot that women do besides having babies. 

RT if you agree. https://t.co/Yo4olU8iE0

Exorbitant student debt continues to put higher education and economic opportunity out of reach for students across the nation. That’s why I’m pushing for a comprehensive database to help students better understand and manage their debt.

With flu cases rising in NH, here’s a friendly reminder that you can get both the flu & COVID-19 vaccines at the same time! Save a trip and get both shots on the same day. Find an appointment at https://t.co/O8Usw8OoKF.

With home heating costs straining family budgets, I’m glad to support this bill to invest in affordable heating options for families by harnessing the power of biomass. I’ll continue working to invest in renewables to meet our energy needs & cut costs for Granite Staters.

These individuals have been through so much to find safety in the U.S. and many of them served alongside U.S. troops in Afghanistan – we should be so lucky to have these brave Afghans as our neighbors & community members here in the U.S.
https://t.co/YlaQoPK2HO

Proud to join the bipartisan Afghan Adjustment Act to help Afghans who came to the U.S. during the evacuation & provide them the opportunity to apply for permanent status and create a life in the U.S.

🚨 Need help paying for home heating bills this winter? Applications are currently being accepted for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) and Weatherization Assistance Programs (WAP): 

Apply through your local CAP: https://t.co/yVu5DIZQGZ https://t.co/cHiAnLRN11

We will never forget the 26 lives horrifically taken at Sandy Hook. My heart goes out to the families on this solemn anniversary. We must honor their memories with action to get weapons of war out of our communities.

American families deserve to live free from gun violence. https://t.co/PhSJcvatRc

We cannot look away from the horrors perpetrated by the Iranian regime. The world must hold the regime accountable for these atrocities & bolster the voices of Iranian civilians fighting for human rights & freedom. 
https://t.co/kLKFSiD4qN

Today, I led a bipartisan group in meeting with @USAmbNATO to discuss Putin’s war in Ukraine and the critical role of @NATO’s support for our democratic partners. Putin’s threat to our world order demonstrates the urgency of a strong #NATO.

Happy 386th birthday, @USNationalGuard! Thank you to all our Guard Members serving in NH & around the world. We are forever grateful for your service to our nation & for being 'Always Ready, Always There.'

Today is a day that will be written into history books. Finally, federal protections for same-sex and interracial couples are signed into law. I’m proud to have helped make this historic law a reality, upholding our country’s commitment to the right to love who you love.

Proud to lead the bipartisan, bicameral International Violence Against Women Act w/ @SenatorCollins and @janschakowsky. Preventing & stopping gender-based violence must be a top U.S. foreign policy priority.

Around the globe, in peace and in conflict, women experience horrific gender-based violence. The U.S. must stand up for all victims of GBV. This isn’t just a moral imperative – this is an investment in U.S. national security & preserving peace and stability around the globe.
Want to stay up to date with what I’m doing for Granite Staters? Follow my Facebook and Instagram too! https://t.co/xbgN3RfPZk

Granite Staters continue to step up to help our Ukrainian friends. Sending many thanks to the volunteers who raised funds for Ukrainian refugees through this holiday celebration in Enfield, which provided traditional food & warm company.

I hosted a discussion today at @NMYMCA to encourage Granite Staters to enroll in health care during Open Enrollment season. Health insurance on https://t.co/8bHLrMxSja is now more affordable than ever – shop for a plan that works for you by Thursday’s deadline. https://t.co/wJDSX3b89N

Congratulations @NASA_Orion for a successful splashdown this morning! This marks the end of the #Artemis I mission & paves the way for continued U.S. space exploration of the Lunar surface & potentially Mars. 🚀

In NH & across the nation, COVID has disproportionately forced women out of the workforce. A new @NHWomensFndn report highlights significant economic disparities & safety concerns facing women that persist. ⬇️
https://t.co/oVEhln7Jrm

We are less than a week away to enroll for health insurance coverage that starts January 1. If you’d like to enroll or change health care plans, do so today! Browse plans at https://t.co/jZzBcoEXgY. https://t.co/mRHhRKJi1k

Glad to see electric rates declining, but heating costs are going to be tough for many NH families this winter. For assistance with heating bills or home energy efficiency improvements, reach out to your local CAP to apply for LIHEAP or weatherization: https://t.co/hCSAlsvITz

The GOP-controlled Exec Council’s decision to block sex ed funding puts young people at risk – particularly as STI cases rise. I’m pushing for direct federal $$ for sex ed programs so parents have the option to enroll their kids in essential sex education.
https://t.co/uoqLwBQZZk

When a disaster hits a rural community, small businesses often face undue red tape as they rebuild. My bill with @SenatorRisch addresses barriers to emergency assistance. I urge @POTUS to swiftly sign it into law. https://t.co/yGpJI2Xwh5

We see the success of the State Trade Expansion Program every day through the NH biz that it’s helped expand & compete in global markets. Reauthorizing & strengthening this program is a no-brainer & I urge lawmakers to support my effort to do just that.
https://t.co/KU7gtu4oTM

Glad to join @NECouncil today to discuss critical policy wins I’ve helped secure that benefit Granite State communities - from lowering energy costs to investing in infrastructure. I'll continue to work with Council members to advocate for NH in Congress.
https://t.co/mgqdhJxhdJ

Calling all veterans: Manchester VA Medical Center will host a PACT Act Week of Action event this Tuesday to inform veterans about the health care & benefits available if they have medical issues potentially related to toxic exposure during their service.
https://t.co/k4HphOp4e7

Thank you to @KeeneState_’s Professor Waller, who is teaching Ukrainians how to properly document war crimes to ensure Russia is prosecuted for its atrocities. It’s great to see Granite Staters stepping up to help Ukrainians amid Russia’s unprovoked and brutal war.

‼️ Scam Alert: Callers posing as organizations or even distant family members solicit money through gift cards & other means. If an unknown caller asks you to make an urgent payment via gift cards, please report it to the @FTC. https://t.co/CUr320FuzB

Thrilled to see the Northern Border Regional Commission announce apps are now open for the 2023 Forest Economy Program grant program. The forest economy helps support many rural communities across the North Country, & I encourage eligible orgs to apply. 
https://t.co/wV5Wbpfptr

Great to see @POTUS announce a new Federal Building Performance Standard, aiming to cut energy use & electrify 30% of federal building space by 2030. Achieving these goals will save money & reduce emissions, & we can get there thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law.

E-cigs are fueling a public health crisis – particularly among teens. It’s outrageous these companies can use a tax loophole to write off the cost of ads that target youth - I’m introducing a bill to close that loophole & hold companies accountable.
https://t.co/pOcjeZrGGQ
Thank you for your leadership to get this over the line, @RepChrisPappas!

Far too many military families wait years, sometimes even decades, for access to info about their lost loved ones. I’m reintroducing the Bring Our Heroes Home Act to help families heal by ensuring records of service members are properly collected & shared.
https://t.co/RXZOxUHj7t

🏳️‍🌈 Love wins! The House just passed the Respect for Marriage Act, sending it to the President’s desk to become law of the land. This is a historic victory to protect the rights of millions of same-sex and interracial couples across our country.

I’m relieved for Brittney Griner & her family as she’s now safely on her way home after nine months of unjust detention & imprisonment in Russia. The U.S. must keep fighting for the release of Paul Whelan & other Americans wrongfully detained abroad.

Thank you to the Blue Star Mothers of NH & volunteers who laid wreaths at the NH State Veterans Cemetery in Boscawen this weekend. This is a beautiful tribute to our fallen heroes this holiday season.  
https://t.co/PdCe566c4o

Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is rightly recognized as TIME’s Person of the Year for his fierce defense of his country amid Russia’s brutal invasion. Thanks to his leadership, Ukraine has defied the odds to defend its freedom, and is an inspiration to all of us. https://t.co/Bu0hgyuO88

All who serve in uniform deserve access to affordable housing. I just introduced the Expanding Home Loans for Guard & Reservists Act to help expand VA home loan eligibility for certain National Guard Members & Reservists.
https://t.co/m53ntZOojg
Both of these bills respond to significant national security concerns and Senate leadership should bring them to the floor for full consideration as swiftly as possible.

We face numerous security challenges around the globe and it’s crucial that we work across the aisle to advance policies that preserve U.S. interests, stand by our partners & maintain peace and stability around the globe.

My bill w/ Sen. Graham builds on my previous work to task a U.S. official responsible for overseeing camps & detention facilities by elevating the seniority of the position & expanding their mandate so it comprehensively addresses the systemic problems facing the camps.

We cannot allow terrorists to turn back the clock & resurrect their campaign of terror that tore through the region, the aftershocks of which are still being felt today, and viciously took the lives of scores of civilians, including Americans like James Foley.

On camps in Syria: The humanitarian & security crises brewing in ISIS detainee & displaced person camps in Syria demands our attention and action today. If the conditions in these camps go unchecked, we risk a resurgence of ISIS. We can’t let that happen.

As a senior member of the Senate Foreign Relations & Armed Services Committees, I’ll continue to work across the aisle in Congress & with the admin to address these issues so that together we can safeguard U.S. national security & preserve our international, rules-based order.

Climate change, food insecurity, disease, terrorism and the host of other security challenges we face are shared by our partners and allies around the world – which is why our response to these challenges should also be shared.
Most significantly, I applaud President Biden’s strategy for cohesively addressing the security challenges we face as a nation and as an interconnected, global community.

Escalating Chinese threats against Taiwan & attacks on nations that support a democratic Taiwan are unacceptable. The Biden admin also rightly prioritizes investments in policies to strengthen U.S. innovation so we can better compete economically & militarily.

At a time when our shared democratic values are under increasing assault from authoritarian regimes, these relationships will also be pivotal to countering growing anti-democratic behavior from China and Russian belligerence.
NATO, AUKUS and the Quad are just a few of the many invaluable alliances & partnerships that advance our national security and preserve global stability.
.@POTUS has done a remarkable job rebuilding our alliances & strengthening our multi-national coalitions – that must endure.

Secretary Albright was a little girl who came to the United States as a refugee fleeing Hitler’s terror who rose to become the face of U.S. diplomacy and foreign policy. Her life epitomizes the American Dream and she never let anyone lose sight of that.
As the only woman on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, I leaned on her for advice and guidance over the years – words of wisdom that I’ll always treasure.

Madeleine Albright shattered the glass ceiling at the State Department when she was sworn in as the first female Secretary of State. In the years since, we have seen women follow in her footsteps and stand on her shoulders as public servants, diplomats, and yes – U.S. Senators.
We were linked through our common bonds as women working in national security structures, which before her were almost entirely off limits to women.
I’m honored to have had the opportunity to not only engage with Secretary Albright in my capacity as a lawmaker, but to have enjoyed her company personally.

✅ $770M for PFAS investigation, testing, remediation & disposal on & around U.S. military installations, including $494M for the Air Force, $167M for the Navy & $98M for the Army. I also fought for an additional $15M to continue the PFAS health impact study I established.

✅ $500M for the Title X Family Planning program, a $214 million increase over last year’s funding level. The Title X program provides critical funding for preventative and primary health care services across the country, including in NH.

✅ $2.8B in increased funding for key federal child care and early learning programs, including $7.3 billion for Child Care and Development Block Grants to states, as well as $12B for Head Start programs.

✅ $370M for the Assistance to Firefighters Grant (AFG) program. The AFG program has long been a top priority for me and provides direct financial assistance to eligible fire departments in order to enhance the safety of firefighters and the public.

✅ $20M for a new Cyber Response and Recovery Fund to provide assistance to state & local governments in the aftermath of cyber attacks. State and local governments have increasingly been targeted by malicious actors seeking to disrupt operations and secure a ransom.

✅ $20 million for continued submarine workforce training and $130 million to support submarine suppliers, including 40 companies in NH to ensure the Granite State remains a critical contributor to current and next-generation submarine programs.

✅ The legislation also continues to provide flexibility provisions I authored that allows for SOR grant dollars to be used to support treatment and recovery for cocaine & methamphetamine misuse, in addition to opioid misuse.

✅ $2 billion in State Opioid Response grant funding, a $500M increase (!) over FY21, as well as the continuing of a 15 percent set-aside of those funds for hardest hit states, like NH, with the highest opioid overdose death rates.

✅ $283M for State & Local Law Assistance and COPS Office grant programs to improve police-community relations. This is an 84% increase in funding & will support programs on de-escalation, implicit bias, crisis intervention & training.

✅ $615M to help communities & first responders address the substance use disorder epidemic, including opioid & drug trafficking. This is $73.5M above last year's funding levels & includes funds that invest in drug, mental health & vet treatment courts and SUD treatment programs.

The stories go on & highlight why the ACA has been such a consequential step forward for so many Granite Staters & Americans. But our work isn't over – I'll continue to fight to expand access to quality, affordable health care that all Americans deserve.

As a college student, Tiffany from Dover struggled to afford the costs of treatment & care for her autoimmune disorder. Though she had health insurance, it was the norm for companies to deny care or increase costs for Americans w/pre-existing conditions. The ACA changed that.

James from Keene & his wife lost their health insurance after she was laid off – making a stressful situation even worse. The ACA helps Americans when they need a hand because cost should never be a barrier to care, & allowed this couple to #GetCovered thru the ACA Marketplace.

Christine from Goffstown had left her job and with it, her employer-sponsored health care plan. To make matters worse, the high cost of COBRA made paying to stay on her old plan out of the question. The ACA opened up options that she wouldn’t have been able to afford otherwise.

David from Merrimack is a proud dad who wants the best for his kids. When his son graduated from college amid an economic downturn, David was worried he'd be left without health insurance. Thanks to the ACA, Americans under 26 like David’s son can stay on their parents’ plan.

This week, we celebrated the 11th anniversary of the ACA, legislation that changed the way we view health care in the U.S. – as a right, not a privilege. To mark the occasion, I want to share some of the stories I've heard from Granite Staters on what the ACA means for them.
